title: It would be really cool if at any point in this season, playing consistently well made you win games
body:
Instead of 95% of games being won or lost because someone has died 10+ times early and is essentially making the game a 4v5.

This is not fun, and it's making it impossible to climb when you're completely at the mercy of the worst player. The 'anti-snowball' mechanics, which really only made games snowball harder, need to be reverted.

Removing all of the gold they dumped on the winning team in the pre-season would be a good starting point. 

Losing a lane early now generates 800+ gold in plating, and lanes that are ahead can't easily help the losing lane without giving up 300+ gold in their own plating, so it's just a lose-lose situation. 

And then the champion who's severely behind farms to try to catch up, and suddenly they have a 500g bounty while still being insanely behind. It's all just free gold for the team that's ahead; not only is the person playing badly essentially useless to the rest of the team, they're also actively generating income for them. You actually have more chance of winning if the player just leaves the game.

The problem isn't bad players. Bad players are going to happen, and have always happened, but they didn't completely and utterly fuck over their entire team as much as they do in this season. It's that bad players provide too much of an advantage for the other team that's the problem.
